columns.text: The goal of the assignment is to explain the similarities and differences between loan and lease acquisition of an asset.

Let's first look at an intuitive idea of each concept:

***What does it mean to borrow to acquire an asset?***

Borrowing is a financial instrument that **makes available non-owned monetary resources to, in this case, acquire an asset**. 

To dispose of non-own monetary resources, a price will have to be paid! This price is the interest on the loan and the lender proposes the terms to the creditor on the payment of interest and principal.

***What does it mean to lease an asset?***

By leasing an asset, the lessee is having access to use it without the need to own it. To dispose of the asset, the lessee will have to pay frequently for its use. 

Between the owner (lessor) and the one who uses the asset (the lessee) the guidelines on the use and lease payments are established.

Depending on the type of lease, the lessor may be free of maintenance payments, taxes, and insurance. In other cases, the lessor will bear these expenses.

***What do borrowing and leasing have in common?*** Both financial instruments are options to dispose of an asset.
